metadata.Title: CVE-2023-31436 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
qfq_change_class in net/sched/sch_qfq.c in the Linux kernel before 6.2.13 allows an out-of-bounds write because lmax can exceed QFQ_MIN_LMAX. Gwangun Jung discovered that the Quick Fair Queueing scheduler implementation in the Linux kernel contained an out-of-bounds write vulnerability. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-31436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-170-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-3.13.0-170-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-170-generic - 3.13.0-194.245
linux-image-unsigned-3.13.0-170-lowlatency - 3.13.0-194.245
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1119-aws - 4.4.0-1119.125
